text: The (Society of the) Iobakchoi (or Iobacchoi) was a second to third century CE Athenian cult association devoted to Dionysus (Bacchus), known from the Iobakchoi inscription (IG, II2, 1368, Athens, 164/165 CE; AGRW ID# 496). == Notes == == External links == * Regulations of the Iobacchoi (164/165 CE) Category:Organizations established in the 2nd century Category:2nd-century establishments Category:Religious organizations established in the 1st millennium Category:Culture of Ancient Athens Category:Cult of Dionysus
title: Iobakchoi
